dt: {bc}the part of the integument of the human head usually covered with hair in both sexes
{bc}the part of an animal (such as a wolf or fox) corresponding to the human scalp
{bc}a part of the human scalp with attached hair cut or torn from an enemy as a token of victory
{bc}a projecting mass of bare ground or rock

et: Middle English, crown of the head, perhaps of Scandinavian origin; akin to Old Norse {it}skālpr{/it} sheath; akin to Middle Dutch {it}schelpe{/it} shell
shortdef: the part of the integument of the human head usually covered with hair in both sexes
the part of an animal (such as a wolf or fox) corresponding to the human scalp
a part of the human scalp with attached hair cut or torn from an enemy as a token of victory

dt: {bc}to remove a desired constituent from and discard the rest
{bc}to buy and sell so as to make small quick profits

shortdef: to remove an upper part from
to remove a desired constituent from and discard the rest

dt: {bc}a long tuft of hair on the crown of the otherwise shaved head especially of a warrior of some American Indian tribes

shortdef: a long tuft of hair on the crown of the otherwise shaved head especially of a warrior of some American Indian tribes

dt: {bc}to want to have someone removed from a position

dt.t: Parents of some students {it}are (going) after the principal's scalp{/it}.

shortdef: to want to have someone removed from a position

dt: {bc}to want to remove someone from a position

shortdef: to want to remove someone from a position
